result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in to case 15CM3274 for the purposes of sentencing.  Court ordered cash bail on deposit be transferred to 15CM3274.

Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 11/04/15 in Branch 40.  State withdrew their offer to the defendant.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Devontes L King in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Devontes L King in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
   Defendant is advised  case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 08:40 am.
JusticePoint Discharge Summary Report received and filed.
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 50.00.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Justice Point Violation Report received and filed.  Defendant tested positive for alcohol and then absconded from Justice Point.  Based upon the violations, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identifed, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.  The 9/18/15 plea and sentencing is vacated.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 09-18-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Devontes L King in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel requests adjournment for plea and sentencing.
Court orders case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 40.
Court advises defendant that all conditions of bail remain as previously set including the No Contact Order.

Defendant Devontes L King in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Devontes L King in custody.  Gale G. Shelton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.
